forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. South southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West wind 1 to 9 mph.

weather_report:
The evening air in Downtown San Francisco carries a crisp clarity, an invitation to breathe deeply and wander the quiet streets. As twilight descends, the temperature gently dips to a comfortable 46 degrees, with the south-southwest breeze weaving through the alleys at a leisurely pace. Tonight, the stars might play coy, tucked away behind the lingering whispers of daylight, but an overall sense of calm prevails, suggesting an ideal backdrop for a tranquil night walk or a cozy gathering over warm drinks.

As dawn unfurls tomorrow, a sunlit greeting awaits, promising a mostly clear landscape that hints at the vibrancy of the day. With highs around 62, the warmth will steadily wrap around you, though it may take a subtle dip to 58 in the afternoon—a reminder of the Bay’s ever-changing temperament. For those contemplating the best attire, layers will serve well; a light jacket can ward off any chill as you sip coffee at your favorite café or stroll through the waterfront parks. Amid this manageable presence of fog and marine layers, it’s a splendid opportunity for a stroll along the Embarcadero, perhaps even indulging in impromptu people-watching or basking in the glow of the city’s charm.
